content: Investments General Asked by AnonymousAsked on 03 Sep 2018Can we buy shares from a foreign country's stock exchange?2 answersAnswerBump0

Prakash KumaraswamiLevel 2. RookieAnswered on 04 Sep 2018Yes you can buy many markets are supported by local brokerages and Banks.Here is a list copied from Phillips Securities However others too support most of these markets.Asia PacificSingapopore (SGX)Malaysia (BURSA)Hong Kong (HKEX)Thailand (SET)Indonesia (IDX)Philippines (PSE)Japan (TSE)Sri Lanka (CSE)South Korea (KRX)Australia (ASX)Taiwan (TWSE)North AmericaUS (NYE, NYSE-MKT, NASDAQ)Canada (TSX)EuropeUK (LSE)Germany (FWB)France (Euronext Paris)Netherlands (Euronext Amsterdam)Portugal (Euronext Lisbon)Belgium (Euronext Brussels)Turkey (BIST)0 comments0

Gabriel Tham, Tag Team Member at Kenichi Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 04 Sep 2018Yes. As long as your broker allows you access to those stock exchanges. Check with your broker on this, each have different access to markets.0 comments0
